images.name: 1_N
images.desc: This was the first semester where we were required to choose electives. Most of us decided to take common courses. Introduction to Algorithms was taken by almost all of the batchmates and we were no exception. With too much research and feedbacks we chose Elements of Business Management and Graph theory as our two other electives. But after attending the first day, we did a complete 180-degree flip and finalized Logic for Computer Science (LCS) and Quantum Computation. Nisarg, Devansh and Aayush attended one lecture of LCS and all of the rest blindly followed their instincts to take LCS just on the faith of these fellows. No one ever dared to attend LCS lectures afterwards. A few brave souls like Aayush, Ashutosh, Aman and Jay still continued with Graph Theory.

images.name: 2_N
images.desc: After two years of eating canteen food for most of the time, we started getting bored. The monotonous taste was no longer bearable. So, we started exploring the world beyond DA. That’s when we started going aggressively to Reliance Chowkdi and Infocity. We ate there 4-5 times a week as compared to once in a week or two weeks before. Trying out new restaurants was itself an adventure that sometimes turned out to be good and sometimes bad. Slowly canteen became ineligible for dinner and Reliance Chowkdi became our own canteen.

images.name: 3_H
images.desc: The best show we could get in 500 bucks. We gave standing ovation too many jokes. Full paisa Vasool show.

images.name: 5_V
images.desc: Cat’s in hostel. Offered it food. We called it Anand bhai (Munnabhai Ref) since it wouldn’t react to our calls when everyone was observing but would react when only 1 person was paying attention.

images.desc: Transformed a normal laptop into Mac in just 30 Rs with the help of McDonalds product. Also, whenever any of us passed through McD, he informed the group about it, so he could get something for them as there is no McD in Gandhinagar.

images.name: 28_H
images.desc: In December 2017, Devansh, Roshan, Chahak with few other Headrush folks, went to Mood Indigo as a Headrush Outstation Trip, to attend the massive lineup of quizzes by some of the best quiz-masters of India._nl__nl_The place where they stayed was one of the most memorable experience in their life. The place was called, Zostel in Marol, Mumbai. It has hostel like dorms with much awesome beds at very reasonable rate! Devansh and Roshan almost fell for the place after looking at the great Mumbai Local Train themed doodling and Bollywood Minimalist Posters painted on the wall. The real fun began at night. As they noticed, the Zostel was famous among foreigners. Night Scene at Zostel was going like this - they had an amazing terrace where a budding band is playing old classic Bollywood songs, foreigners are enjoying the music with holding beer in one hand and weed in other. Since (unfortunately) none of us smoke/drink we were just sitting in the corner stumbling on mobile. And the lead singer of the band might have felt this insulting and gave the mic to Chahak and Devansh to sing for a while. Both of them slipped one by one by saying - "Oh, I got a call, have to pick up this". After a music night, there were few rounds of Cards Against Humanity and UNO arranged. Luckily, we were there on the Christmas Night, so got to enjoy these many events!
